title: Aust, US exchange details in tax crackdown (AAP)
content:
Tax authorities in Australia and the US have started exchanging details on bank accounts as part of a cross-border crackdown on tax dodgers. 

Details of more than 30,000 financial accounts held in Australia by US citizens will be provided to the US Internal Revenue Service under the first wave of transparency measures being implemented by governments and tax administrations across the world. 

In return, the ATO will get data from the US about Australians with US accounts which it will use to try to detect instances of undeclared offshore income and tax evasion.
